function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Transmission rate estimation may be inaccurate","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation can lead to ineffective mitigation strategies and resource allocation","Mitigation":"Improve data collection methods, validate estimates with multiple sources, and use advanced statistical analysis techniques","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, statistical modeling software, and advanced data collection methods","People":"Epidemiologists, public health researchers, and policymakers","Owner":"Public health authorities, research institutions, and government agencies"},{"Description":"Model comparison may lead to incorrect conclusions","Impact":"Incorrect conclusions can result in inappropriate public health interventions and resource allocation","Mitigation":"Use rigorous statistical methods, consider all relevant variables, and consult with domain experts","Technologies":"Statistical software, data visualization tools, and domain-specific knowledge","People":"Data analysts, epidemiologists, and public health researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, and government agencies"},{"Description":"Use of outdated or invalid models","Impact":"Invalid models can result in misleading findings and ineffective policy decisions","Mitigation":"Regularly update models with new data, validate model assumptions, and consult with domain experts","Technologies":"Model updating tools, sensitivity analysis software, and domain-specific knowledge","People":"Modelers, data analysts, and epidemiologists","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, and government agencies"}]}
